paragraphs.text: Je Suis Charlie? Media need to stop covering for murderous Muslims.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Every Islamic terror attack is like a grenade
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The blast brutally kills and cripples its victims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Most nearby dive for cover
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That's what the American media have been doing for decades
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Every time another Muslim terrorist beheads, butchers or bombs, journalists do their best to hide from the reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or quickly cover up the result as if they believe the rest of us will soon forget
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Recent terror attacks in the United States, Canada, Australia and Israel(journalists love to skip them) haven't stopped the short-term memory wipe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On Monday evening and Tuesday morning, ABC, CBS and NBC left out the Islamic connection from the trial of alleged Boston bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ABC Chief Investigative Reporter Brian Ross speculated that,"the jury will also see this bullet-pocked anti-American message."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Islam?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Nope
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Terrorists attacked the magazine Charlie Hebdo 24 hours later
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The lions of the free press who are now supportive of the magazine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But they are the same ones who gave credence to Obama's claims that an obscure YouTube video was the cause for a terror attack that killed a U.S  ambassador
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not the Islamic monsters who did the attack
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Remember the media reaction to the riots over Danish cartoons depicting Mohammad in 2005
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Two hundred people died in global riots
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Even now, the newspaper that published the cartoons must boost security
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it wasn't just whether to run the images
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was the rationale
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The New York Times didn't publish the cartoons, calling them "no less hurtful to most Muslims than Nazi caricatures of Jews or Ku Klux Klan caricatures of blacks are to those victims of intolerance."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "That is why the Danish cartoons will not be reproduced on these pages," it wrote
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In the wake of the latest attack the Times used Twitter to blame the victims saying "#CharlieHebdo has long tested limits with its satire."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Financial Times associate editor Tony Barber, soon after the attack, blamed the magazine for having "a long record of mocking, baiting and needling French Muslims."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I didn't know "needling" warranted the death penalty
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: USA Today responded with the dangerous rantings of Anjem Choudary, "a radical Muslim cleric," who also criticized the cartoonists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Islam does not mean peace but rather means submission to the commands of Allah alone," he admitted
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Free people aren't surprised
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He added,"Muslims do not believe in the concept of freedom of expression."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: That anti-freedom argument is what news outlets are surrendering to
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But they are hardly the only cowardly media involved
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Hollywood has been running scared from radical Islam for years - far worse than how it handled North Korea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When Tom Clancy's "Sum of All Fears" hit the big screen, the terrorists who nuke an American city were no longer dangerous Islamists as they were in the book
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Evil Russians were "far more acceptable both to Hollywood sensibilities and the Arab ethnic lobby," reported Slate
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Hollywood bowed to the Muslim pressure group the Council on American-Islamic Relations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ABC Family killed"controversial" "Alice in Arabia" rather than offend Muslims
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The TV show"South Park" depicted Mohammed in a bear suit in one episode, to avoid showing an actual image
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The writers still received death threats
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Comedy Central killed the next episode before Islamists did the same to its staff
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Two Muslim converts were convicted in the case
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A Facebook protest of the "South Park" fiasco called"Everybody Draw Mohammed Day" resulted in more threats
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Artist Molly Norris ended up "moving, changing her name and essentially wiping away her identity," according to The Seattle Weekly
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Even a Yale University Press book about the Danish cartoon controversy wouldn't include the images that were the subject matter of the book"because the University and the Press are concerned about a possible resurgence of violence," wrote The Yale Daily News
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Then why do the book at all?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Journalists labeled those criticizing Islam "phobes," rather than blame Muslims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Time ran a cover story asking"Is America Islamophobic?" with the preconceived answer that "hate speech against Muslims and Islam is growing both more widespread and more heated."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's all part of how media and the left redefine reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Terrorists" become"militants" and "terrorism" becomes "workplace violence."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: All to hide reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until more people are slaughtered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Journalists can't hide that many bodies
paragraphs.label: assumption
